clarifications.question: KQ C6 addresses sexualized breastfeeding, a lot of the indicators have an overlap with sexual solicitation, should reviewers label this as solicitation or under ANSA?
clarifications.answer: If the content meets the thresholds of ANSA, please label accordingly. If it meets the thresholds of SSPx of nudity + interaction information, please label accordingly. (IS 16.2.a, KQ A3.1.e)

clarifications.summary: Visible anus photoshopped onto public figure
clarifications.question: Visible anus photoshopped onto public figure has been removed from the IS, does this mean this type of content should be labelled going forward?
clarifications.answer: Yes.

clarifications.question: In the definition for near nudity, the 2nd point states 'when genitalia is cropped out but nudity is implicit' what is meant here by 'nudity is implicit'?
clarifications.answer: It means that despite the cropping it is clear that the PDITI is nude around the genitalia

clarifications.summary: Implied oral sex - videos vs still images
clarifications.question: Regarding Implied oral sex - When there is at least one PDITI engaging in sexual movements related to oral sex. Is the sexual movement applicable on both videos and still imagery? Is the same guidance applicable on sexual expression on still images?
clarifications.answer: (1) Only videos or gifs (2) Sexual expression can be seen in still images also - see KQ G4

clarifications.summary: Active stripping definition - videos and photos
clarifications.question: Considering the proposed definition of 'active stripping' should we understand that this applies to all imagery, both video and photos? so there is no requirement, going forward, to see the actual movement of the removal?
clarifications.answer: Yes, that is accurate. It applies to videos and photos and actual movement might not be visible in photos but if you can see indication or the person trying to strip and remove clothing - consider that.

clarifications.question: Can you please provide more clarity on the stripping definition? should we consider any type of clothing removal as stripping, like removing socks?
clarifications.answer: Removing socks alone will not be stripping. Removal of clothes in a manner that aims to reveal commonly sexualized body parts will come under this definition.

clarifications.question: Do we no longer require the mention of 'exclusive/private content' in conjunction with 18+ to consider as an indicator for sexual encounter, after the update?
clarifications.answer: Yes we no longer require exclusive/private content.

clarifications.question: How do we assess if a link is leading to an external pornographic website(s)?
clarifications.answer: If an indicator on the website depicts a 'Sexual Encounter', we can consider it pornographic or an adult website.

clarifications.summary: Social media handles - follow me scenarios
clarifications.question: Since social media links and usernames continue to not be considered asking/offering, but going forward we are going to consider 'follow me' as interaction. Can you clarify the correct action?
clarifications.answer: If it says 'follow me @xxx' or just '@xxx' and the handle is a social media handle, do not treat as interaction information. If it says 'follow me on my insta account' without specifying the handle, please consider interaction information. If there is any indication that the handle doesn't link to a social media profile (e.g. mention of 'OF'), consider it to be interaction information.

clarifications.summary: Sexually suggestive pose - legs spread with underwear
clarifications.question: Is our understanding correct that if there is a depiction of PDITI spreading legs when they wear t-shirt in the upper body and only underwear in the lower body, we can consider this as sexually suggestive pose?
clarifications.answer: Yes you can consider this a sexually suggestive pose.

clarifications.question: When considering KQ A3 what is a depiction or mention of sexual encounter(s)? when we consider the mentioning of '18+', should we also consider terms/emojis with the same meaning, for example the ðŸ”ž emoji?
clarifications.answer: Yes!

clarifications.question: Would a 'payment successful' screenshot, or a proof of payment from one user to another one (through Revolut, Paypal, Cashapp,...) also count as a transaction indicator?
clarifications.answer: Yes it would.

clarifications.summary: Sexual audio - applies to all lengths
clarifications.question: Is sexual audio in relation to less than 10sec or more than 10 sec?
clarifications.answer: It is applied to both.

clarifications.question: How do we define graphic detail for SEL?
clarifications.answer: If there is an explicit mention of sexual encounters ('fucked', 'had sex', 'did anal') coupled with an adverb or adjective, consider it SEL. 'Fucked softly' = SEL. If there is an indirect mention ('made love', 'spent the night together', 'had spicy time'), this would NOT be SEL.

clarifications.question: Can you confirm any off-platform link qualifies as ask/offer, including just the mention of 'external link'?
clarifications.answer: Yes, any external links is enough to consider as ask/offer and interaction element.

clarifications.question: Is 'bottom' + 'discount' sufficient for Prostitution?
clarifications.answer: Yes, Example 2 is sufficient. We will be revamping the slang terms list shortly.

clarifications.question: How would you define 'ask for weapons'? Is it asking about the price, the quality, the quantity, information about the weapon?
clarifications.answer: Yes

clarifications.summary: Animal fights in wild - no longer carveout
clarifications.question: The line about Animal to animal fights in the wild has been removed from the IS, how should this be actioned going forward?
clarifications.answer: Yes, we no longer have a carveout for animal-to-animal fights in the wild, so it should be labeled like any other imagery of animals (mutilated animals, animals with visible blood, animals going from live to dead, etc.)

clarifications.question: In IS of 'Non medical object piercing skin' the line 'Religious or cultural context (e.g., self-flagellation)' is removed, is it correct to keep label content under this scenario?
clarifications.answer: Yes, the policy line was deprecated because we no longer distinguish between religious/cultural context and any other context. Everything should be labelled as 'non-medical objects piercing skin' regardless of the context.

clarifications.question: We would like to seek your clarification that whether or not we no longer consider suicide admission from 3rd person with SSI intention in AAPC SSI?
clarifications.answer: SSI admission will be self-Referential. Third person will be covered SSI Reference.

clarifications.question: For tobacco there is a UDT label 'Incidental Consumption' but this is not defined anywhere in the policy. What goes under this label?
clarifications.answer: Please use the 'Incidental Consumption' node for scenarios in which Media depicting tobacco consumption in a non-fictional context in video, if depiction is less than 5 consecutive seconds

clarifications.question: How to approach cases where a subject is drinking an unknown liquid from a bottle/can/cup/glass/shot glass? Does the presence of a glass specifically associated with alcoholic beverages lead to a specific action?
clarifications.answer: The presence of a glass specifically associated with alcoholic beverages is a signal that there is alcohol in the content. From here, you should act accordingly based on the other context signals present (e.g. brand promotion, sale, etc.)

clarifications.summary: Female nipples outline through clothing = No Action
clarifications.answer: The client clarified that the outline of female nipples visible through clothing should no longer be considered 'near nudity', instead please consider these scenarios benign (No Action).

clarifications.question: We've been noticing the expression 'videos caseiros' surfacing in our queues, usually in borderline content for Sexual Solicitation and/or Nudity and Sexual Activity. Since it's not a slang term in our lists, could we accept the context that it refers to sexual imagery?
clarifications.answer: As per market knowledge we understand the context of the expressions 'videos caseiros' and by the sample shared we also have plenty other indicators/signals that would fulfill Sexual Solicitation requirements, content should be enforced as violating. We can consider it as a sexual hint.

Client has confirmed as CSAM content: Screenshots of a young girl with black curly hair, wearing a purple dress looking over her shoulder who seems to be twerking outside a house. In some cases these screenshots are watermarked with 'david.fanta'. Any instance of this content, soliciting/sharing of said content, should be escalated for CSAM (even non-violating screenshots).

clarifications.summary: Violence by deity vs violence via prayer
clarifications.answer: Calls for violence perpetrated by a deity are not violating for V&I. However, if the user is wishing/praying to a deity for violence to be committed by someone else, it is violating for V&I. If the target is a PC, it is violating either way.

clarifications.question: In the last few weeks we started receiving items with photos/videos in which people appear inhaling something liquid straight from a tube. Can we use our market knowledge to identify visually the good and assume the consumption of non-medical drugs?
clarifications.answer: You are correct, we can use market knowledge in this case since lolÃ³/lanÃ§a-perfume is a pretty common non-medical drug within our market.

clarifications.question: Jobs present themselves with the usual layout of an inheritance scam but instead of the usual mention of money, they use other terms like 'patrimÃ³nio', 'riqueza' and 'bens'. Should we consider No Action?
clarifications.answer: You can consider 'riqueza' and 'fortuna' as rewards of real money for the purpose of Giveaway Fraud, but for 'patrimonio' and 'bens' do not consider them as offers of real money.

clarifications.question: Can we assume 'patrocinar/patrocinador' as hint at price, since sponsorships and patrons involve an exchange, usually of money for content?
clarifications.answer: Patrocinar/Patrocinador should not be assumed as a hint of price.

clarifications.question: Would having the PDITI face clearly depicted qualify for identity reveal in creepshots?
clarifications.answer: Showing someone's face alone does not qualify as 'revealing identity' for Creepshots. We can consider as examples: (1) captions that reveal the name/username, (2) digitally drawn circles or arrows that highlight the face, (3) digitally inserted face where otherwise not visible. The idea is that the person has taken an extra step to highlight the PDITI's identity.

Content depicts a cutesy edit of Mark Zuckerberg paired with a nazi symbol. As per Dangerous Orgs KQ A12 'Humor and satire is content that compares or contrasts a designated entity with an undesignated individual, undesignated organization, or object.' = No Action

With the recent update (June 11th), 'Profane expressions of sexual activity' was removed from BH. Now: 'I want to fuck you' = SSPx. 'I want to lick your feet' = SSPx. 'I'm going to fuck you' = BH. 'I will lick your feet' = BH. Rule: 'Want to' (desire) = SSPx. 'Going to/Will' (imposition) = BH.

clarifications.summary: Stolen Goods - follow UDT hierarchy (CHPC > FSDP)
clarifications.question: Is there a specific list of physical/digital products for Stolen Goods? Otherwise Coordinating Harm would always take precedence.
clarifications.answer: No, there is no specific list. Please follow the hierarchy of the UDT to identify if the violation should be considered Coordinating Harm or FSDP.

clarifications.question: Can we confirm that the UDT order is the hierarchy within the FSDP policy?
clarifications.answer: Yes, that is correct. Please follow the hierarchy of the UDT.

clarifications.summary: HE vs FSDP overlap - HE takes precedence
clarifications.question: There are scenarios where indicators for Fraud will overlap with Labor Exploitation. Per hierarchy HEx is higher than Fraud. Can you clarify?
clarifications.answer: You should follow the hierarchy of actions. If content is violating for both Human Exploitation and Frauds and Scams, it should be considered as Human Exploitation. If content contains some Labor Exploitation/Abuse signals, but not enough to violate, it should be considered for other violations, including Fraud and Scams.
